Subject: 
Contingency  Plan for  handling  aircraft  hijack situation. 
 
 
Contingency Plan for  handling  aircraft  hijack situation has  been 
approved  by the  Cabinet Committee on Security (CCS) and circulated   vide 
Ministry of  Civil  Aviation Office Memorandum No. AV.13024/2/2000-SS dated 
13.9.2005. 
 
2. 
Para  1.7(a) of  the  Contingency  Plan provides  that all efforts  should  be 
made   to get  an hijacked  Indian registered  aircraft  to land  at an Indian Airport  
preferably  one of  those  already  identified  for this  purpose. Once  such  an 
aircraft  lands  at an Indian airport  it shall  be  immediately   immobilized and  
shall not be allowed to  go out of India. 
 
3. 
In view of the  above the  following  instructions shall be strictly  
implemented  by all concerned :- 
 
(i) 
The Indian registered  hijacked aircraft  shall be  directed  by 
the concerned  ATC to land  at  one  of the  airports, which 
have  already been identified  for  this  purpose, namely: 
Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai, Thiruvananthapuram, Nagpur,  
Hyderabad, 
Ahmedabad, 
Bangalore, 
Guwahati 
and  
Chandigarh; and   
 
(ii) 
On landing at one of the identified airports, such an aircraft  
shall be immediately   immobilized   as per   instructions  
issued  vide  BCAS  AVSEC  Order  No. 9/2001 dated 
16.11.2001  (copy enclosed).  In order to avoid delay in this 
regard immediate necessary    action to immobilize the 
aircraft    shall be taken  by the  Airport  Director, AAI or  the 
In-charge  Aerodrome  of the affected  airport.

AVSEC   ORDER    9  / 2001 
 
 
In exercise of the powers, conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934 
(XXII of 1934) , delegated  to him  by the  Central  Government   vide  the  Government 
of India, Ministry of  Civil Aviation  notification   S.O.  number  1797,   dated the 3rd July 
, 1997, the  Commissioner of Security , Civil  Aviation  , Bureau of  Civil  Aviation 
Security,  for the purpose of security of the aircraft operations, directs that :- 
 
If an aircraft registered in India, is hijacked and lands at any airport in India, it 
shall not be allowed to take off. The aircraft shall be immobilized by any of the 
undermentioned procedure found  suitable at that time 
 
Positioning vehicles/ fire tenders on the runway. 
Deflating of tyres by personnel coming from the rear end. 
Putting off the lights of the runway/ taxi track (at night). 
Any other means, without endangering the safety of the aircraft and the security of 
passenger.
